p: Beginning in December 2019, a number of patients with pneumonia of unknown aetiology emerged in Wuhan City, Hubei Province, Central China. Genome sequencing has demonstrated that this pneumonia, named coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), is caused by a novel CoV, namely severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), previously known as 2019 novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) [11], [12], [13]. Like SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, this newly emerged SARS-CoV-2 virus belongs to the B lineage of the Î²-CoVs.
